external.gw.api.financials

Interface CurrencyAmount

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<CurrencyAmount>, GWRemotable, IDimension<CurrencyAmount,java.math.BigDecimal>, IMoney, ISequenceable<CurrencyAmount,java.math.BigDecimal,Currency>
    Deprecated. 
    External entities are deprecated. Please use the new Java API instead.

    @Deprecated
public interface CurrencyAmount
extends IMoney, IDimension<CurrencyAmount,java.math.BigDecimal>, ISequenceable<CurrencyAmount,java.math.BigDecimal,Currency>, GWRemotable, java.lang.Comparable<CurrencyAmount>
    Represents a monetary amount with a currency.

    CurrencyAmounts can be used in two "modes". "Strict" CurrencyAmounts require a currency, and further require that their amounts have a scale appropriate for their currency. An attempt to create a "strict" CurrencyAmount (#getStrict(java.math.BigDecimal, com.guidewire.ab.external.typelist.Currency) either with a null currency, or with a value that cannot be set to the currency scale without rounding, will fail.

    "Non-strict" CurrencyAmounts can have any scale and have an optional currency. This mode exists primarily for backwards-compatibility. The methods that operate in "non-strict" mode have been deprecated. In Gosu, mathematical operators (e.g., +) can be used with CurrencyAmounts, and CurrencyAmounts are interchangeable with BigDecimals. These operations all occur in "non-strict" mode. That is, the results of these operations should be considered "non-strict" CurrencyAmounts.

    This class contains many methods that exist on BigDecimal, in deprecated form. This is because in prior versions, CurrencyAmount extended BigDecimal. Now, it composes a BigDecimal and a Currency.

      • addSecondaryMoneyComponent

        CurrencyAmountPair addSecondaryMoneyComponent(Currency secondaryCurrency)
        Deprecated. 
        Calculates the equivalent of this CurrencyAmount in the secondaryCurrency, and returns a new CurrencyAmount with that secondary CurrencyAmount as the SecondaryMoneyComponent.

        Does nothing if this.Currency and the secondaryCurrency are equal or null

        Parameters:
        secondaryCurrency -
        Returns:
        a new CurrencyAmount, same value as before, but with SecondaryMoneyComponent set.

      • addStrict

        CurrencyAmount addStrict(CurrencyAmount amount)
        Deprecated. 
        Calculates this + amount. If both specify a currency, then the currencies must match. If one specifies a currency, then the result will be in that currency. If neither specifies a currency, then the result will be in the default currency.
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Returns:
        a currency amount scaled appropriately for the associated currency.

      • compareMultiCurrency

        int compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount o)
        Deprecated. 
        Compares this currency amount with another, which may be of a different currency. If both currency amounts specify a currency, and the currencies are different, then the given currency amount is converted into this currency amount's currency before the amounts are compared. The conversion is based on current market exchange rates and the result is rounded using the default rounding mode.

        After possible conversion, the currency amounts are compared according to compareTo(CurrencyAmount) .

        Parameters:
        o -

      • compareTo

        int compareTo(CurrencyAmount o)
        Deprecated. 
        Compares this currency amount with another by comparing their numeric amounts. If both currency amounts specify a currency, then the currencies must be the same.

        See Comparable.compareTo(T) for an explanation of the int return value.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<CurrencyAmount>
        Parameters:
        o -

      • convert

        CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency,
                     java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts this CurrencyAmount into one in the given currency, according to the current market exchange rate, with the resulting amount rounded according to the given rounding mode.

        If either currency is null, or if the currencies are the same, returns this instance.

        Parameters:
        toCurrency -
        roundingMode -

      • setScaleToCurrency

        CurrencyAmount setScaleToCurrency()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a CurrencyAmount with the same amount as this one, but with scale set to the appropriate value for the currency. No rounding is allowed.

        Returns:
        A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().subtract(amount.getAmount(), mc) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

      • subtractAsSameCurrency

        CurrencyAmount subtractAsSameCurrency(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        Deprecated. 
        Add amount to this. This is a convenience method and makes this: this.add(new BigDecimal(23)) semantically equivalent to this.add(new CurrencyAmount(new BigDecimal(23), this.getCurrency())
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Returns:
        A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

      • subtractAsSameCurrency

        CurrencyAmount subtractAsSameCurrency(java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                    java.math.MathContext mc)
        Deprecated. 
        Add amount to this. This is a convenience method and makes this: this.add(new BigDecimal(23), mc) semantically equivalent to this.add(new CurrencyAmount(new BigDecimal(23), this.getCurrency(), mc)
        Parameters:
        amount -
        mc -
        Returns:
        A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount, mc) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

      • subtractStrict

        CurrencyAmount subtractStrict(CurrencyAmount amount)
        Deprecated. 
        Subtracts two CurrencyAmounts. If both specify a currency, then the currencies must match. If one specifies a currency, then the result will be in that currency. If neither specifies a currency, then the result will be in the default currency.
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Returns:
        a currency amount scaled appropriately for the associated currency.
